original_title: Sri Lanka rupee stronger at Rs318/320 to US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 322/325 to the US dollar around the same level as Tuesday’s close of 321/323 to the US dollar, dealers said.
In intra-day trade, the rupee was quoted around 318/320 to the US dollar.
Sri Lanka’s central bank is now operating deflationary policy and there is also private sector sterilization where banks are not lending all the deposits they get.
Under deflationary policy, a pegged central bank can take the exchange rate anywhere, analysts say.

An appreciating rupee can go beyond ‘disinflation’ seen in IMF backed so-called basket case countries which target a nakedly Mercantilist real effective exchange rate de facto, and see some actual price falls, analysts say.

Some Sri Lanka exporters have given around 35 percent salary hikes following the 2022 collapse of the rupee on inflationary policy, while electricity prices are also up. Their others costs including food and transport for staff are already up.
Sri Lanka’s inflation started to fall steeply as the central bank operated guidance peg at around 360/370 to the US dollar.
Sri Lanka’s central bank had bought about 950 million dollars from the market so far this year, according to IMF documents. (Colombo/Mar23/2023)
